title: Use of moved closure suggests using a move reference instead of borrowing the closure
body:
I tried this code: ```rust fn take_closure_ref(f: &impl Fn(&X) -> bool, x: &X) -> bool { f(&x) } fn take_closure(f: impl Fn(&X) -> bool, xs: Vec) { let _ys = xs .iter() .filter(move |x_c| take_closure_ref(&f, *x_c)) .filter_map(move |x_c| { if take_closure_ref(&f, x_c) { Some(1) } else { None } }); } ``` I expected to see this happen: Some kind of borrow checker error due to moving the closure argument `f` twice when running ``cargo check``. Instead, this happened: The help hint suggests making a move reference `&move ..` while claiming to "consider borrowing `f`". See backtrace below. Attempting to follow the suggestion makes the same thing happen, but with more references, e.g. `&&move`, `&&&move`.... ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.61.0 (fe5b13d68 2022-05-18) binary: rustc commit-hash: fe5b13d681f25ee6474be29d748c65adcd91f69e commit-date: 2022-05-18 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.61.0 LLVM version: 14.0.0 ``` (found on beta and nightly channels on Rust Playground also)
Backtrace

```shell error[E0382]: use of moved value: `f` --> src/main.rs:8:21 | 4 | fn take_closure(f: impl Fn(&X) -> bool, xs: Vec) { | - move occurs because `f` has type `impl Fn(&X) -> bool`, which does not implement the `Copy` trait ... 7 | .filter(move |x_c| take_closure_ref(&f, *x_c)) | ---------- - variable moved due to use in closure | | | value moved into closure here 8 | .filter_map(move |x_c| { | ^^^^^^^^^^ value used here after move 9 | if take_closure_ref(&f, x_c) { | - use occurs due to use in closure | help: consider borrowing `f` | 7 | .filter(&move |x_c| take_closure_ref(&f, *x_c)) | + For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0382`. error: could not compile `closure_bug` due to previous error ```
